result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tarel L Perkins

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Tarel L Perkins not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Tarel L Perkins.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Paul Leonard Tiffin for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer. Case is in resolution posture. Court adjourns matter for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tarel L Perkins in court with Student Intern Damon Terrell under the supervision of Attorney Jade K Hall; parties appear by video.  Defendant Tarel L Perkins in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF68. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Saavedra. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Student Intern Damon Terrell under the supervision of Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Tarel L Perkins not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Perkins is housed at MSDF where he wasn't joined by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tarel L Perkins not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tarel L Perkins in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Tarel L Perkins in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tarel L Perkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
